page.title: 06Leybourne Primary School
page.content: Leybourne village school has been in the local news recently. Parents living on new estates in the area were dismayed to find that their children would be unable to attend their local school due to a shortage of staff and accommodation. Instead places would be made available in nearby Larkfield schools. Campaigning by parents and governors for Leybourne school to be enlarged has apparently met with some success. A "Kent Messenger" headline of July 5th 1985 states "Primary school to get two new classrooms". The article states that an extra teacher has been allocated to the school for a year from September. Parents are hoping that a permanent solution to the problem can soon be found.
